comment: Despite living in the US for 15+ years he still has a significant accent which can make him hard to understand, he frequently stresses hw yet it's only 10% of the final grade, claims that the example problems are similar to the test which is a lie. Be prepared to teach yourself the majority of the content and heads up the textbook is useless
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Very nice guy, but bad professor. He does not know to teach, only how to read of slides. As a physics major I had all A's in every math I've taken yet I had to drop this class as the professor makes it impossible to learn and understand. If you ask a question he interrupts you answering a question you didn't even ask. Nice guy, bad professor.

His lectures are hard to understand because of his accent but if you teach the material to yourself you will be fine. His tests are very easy and at most will have 1 hard question. He will say in class that he will ask reasonable questions on the test and that he isn't trying to trick you. Calc 2 is a hard class but you will be fine if you study.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Professor Ji is very smart, and will explain in depth on the theory of whatever he is covering. His lectures alone will not be enough to pass. However, if you go lectures and find additional tutoring to go over example problems it takes his lectures from being ok to amazing. Like ~90% of your grade comes from tests. Be prepared for those.
rating_tags: Inspirational--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: going to class is useless, but if you go, go only before test days he gives you similar problems to ones on the test. super funny guy. hw is always harder than test problems. he also gave us extra credit on the final if we got an A on the final then he replaced it with our 2 lowest tests. his accent isn't tooo bad but he's a good guy (sometimes).

Professor Ji is a great professor, it had been a while since I had taken a math class, he explains concepts until you are able to understand them. Before the exam he also gives you a list of problems to go over that would be similar to the exam. He honestly is a caring professor and he wants you to pass his class. If you come to class you'd be ok.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: SO, so much homework in this class with ALEKS. The tests aren't too hard, as he uses questions straight from ALEKS and often picks fairly easy ones. Explains things quite well but too quickly sometimes. You're best off just focusing on ALEKS and its content in this classes. Bit of an accent as well if that's a problem for you.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: This Professor mainly read off the slides and did some example problems. I personally wasn't a fan on how he taught, but I also never payed attention because I already knew the material but his tests are straight from aleks so it made it a lot easier. I wouldn't recommend taking him if you're not confident in your math skills.

Save you the trouble from reading all this: Don't take this guy if you care about your GPA or graduating. Reads off a powerpoint. Expects us to know everything on the first day. There's three tests that are 30% of your grade. Exam 1 (30%). Exam 2 (30%) and the Final (30%). If you fail one of them, you're basically done. Hw is 10%.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Mr. Ji is a very kind and lenient professor. He wants his students to perform well. He puts a lot of weight on the final, so if you perform well on that, he might bump your grade up some points since you demonstrated understanding. Random attendance is taken, so I recommend going. And do Aleks since you will learn the material from there.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Jun Ji is insulting and berates the class every time a question is asked. He reminds you every single lecture how bad he is. He is the worst professor imaginable so much I had to create an acct to warn you not to take him. 10% HW, and 90% tests. 3 tests the whole semester. He couldn't even not insult us during the test I swear it was incredible....
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Half of the reviews here feel like a war zone. Not sure why. This dude is super nice and explains stuff better than anyone at this school. He also cares a lot of students so, he'll go in great lengths to make stuff engaging. Super smart guy. Not sure what the bad reviews are talking about.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy

comment: Diff eq is a hard class. Dr Ji sometimes reads off powerpoints which I found hard to follow. Class was weighted 30% first two tests 35% final and 5% on a quiz. Test questions weren't awful but sometimes can be a time crunch if you get stuck on one. Not awful professor, would be a 4 or 5 if class wasn't so heavily weighted on tests.
rating_tags: Caring--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Prof. Ji is a good professor. I took him for calc 2 and went off his lecture notes for tests and did fine. He wants you to do well in his class and is always willing to help you. If you do the HW and pay attention in class, you should have no issue with his class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Ji does not explain the topics clearly and expects you to already have extended knowledge of the necessary materials (understandable). He knows his stuff but has a hard time explaining the material due to a language barrier. The HWs will be your saving grace but they are very long and take the whole day to complete. Take as a last option.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Don't take this class. He expects you to know how to do it yourself so he won't explain what he's doing in lectures he just does it. I taught myself all through aleks which helped but the amount of homework given was crazy. So much homework that counts for only 14% of your grade. Tests are 75% and there's only three plus the final which is 20%.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Jin is very straightforward, differential equations is already a hard class, but if you pay attention and do the homework he assigns you will do fine. Tests and quizzes are easier than the homework. A lot of the problems use calculus 2, so if you learned calc 2 really good, this class should not be too difficult.

Diff Eq wasn't a class I was looking forward to in January, but I was pleasantly surprised it wasn't too difficult with Professor Ji. His lectures can be long and boring, but if you do the homework you'll ace his quizzes and tests. Grade is off of 2 tests worth 50%, a final worth 40%, 7, for me, quizzes worth 5%, and attendance worth 5%.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: You will learn the material if you put the effort. Few hard hw problems, but if you do them youll ace the quizzes and tests. Do the few hw problems and asks questions how to do them. He makes the quizzes and tests fair/easy compared to the hw. Only gripe is final is 40% of your grade. It can only bring you way up or down.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Test heavy

comment: Nice guy, but be prepared to teach yourself everything because his lectures are insulting. He types up notes beforehand in a word document and scrolls fast. His English exceptionally poor, unable to understand student questions. Sometimes he doesn't prepare example problems at all and frequently worked out homework incorrectly. Attendance mandatory
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Multiple quizzes, Two test and a final. His HW is challenging/optional. You will learn the material doing his HW making his tests fair. His partial credit can be rough but if you show that you put in the effort to learn he can be caring. Lecture is alright.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: I don't think Dr. Ji would ever fail anyone who really tried. However, he can be harsh and he will make comments about quizzes (without names) in front of the class, which can be embarrassing. Attendance is mandatoryish (there is leeway), and the book is required. Overall, this course is not hard, but Dr. Ji will make you feel judged sometimes.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: The class was a nightmare. Not because of the course material. No that I understood. It is the professor that made it horible. Have you ever wanted to have a professor yelling at the entire class for not being good enough and calling people out for making mistakes on their quiz in front of the class while taking a quiz everysingle time? DO NOT TAKE
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: The material in this class isn't too bad, but he likes to see that you care about the material. Ask questions, show up, and follow through throughout the semester and you will be fine. The textbook is extremely clear, I found it as an online PDF. If you read through that, make sure he sees you try, and you'll be completely fine.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: He's a bit fast-paced, yes. However, he really cares about his students, and he never condescends. He always addressed as, "My friends," and when you asked a question about material you didn't get, he almost always knew exactly which part gave you trouble. That's a rare talent for professors, so, yes, I absolutely recommend him.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Inspirational

comment: Hilarious fun-loving guy who really loves math! But is a speed demon in class and expects you to pick up the material quickly. Also speaks Poor English so it can be hard to understand. Overall if you dont do the homework everyday you will get behind.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This professor was pretty fair. After every lecture, he uploaded reference problems (or homework, as he would call it) on D2L. They werent mandatory, but they sure did help a lot, especially when it came to quizzes and tests. The reference problems are more difficult than the quizzes and tests, and he even goes over them in class before moving on!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Honestly, he was really good. What he teaches is exactly what is on the tests. Just review the notes and an Easy A

Avoid at all cost! He is a speed demon. I don't think you can teach math with a PDF slides. You won't get a chance to absorb the information, because he went over it so fast. He looks down upon his students, being not smart enough. I'm sure he knows the material very well, but unable to teach it to students. I learn it better from Khan Academy.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: Professor Jun knows Math very well. He loves Math and gets excited about it. There is a bit of a cultural difference, and explanations do not come across at times. He spreads grades across homework, online tests, quizzes and attendance, and in-class tests. Homework is very difficult and time consuming. You'll know what you are doing if you take Jun
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: One of the best mathematics professors I've ever had! He is a master of mathematics and truly loves the math he teaches. He inspires his students to find the beauty found in mathematics. He is almost always in his office after class and is willing help you learn the material. His class is difficult, however I studied very diligently and made an A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Hilarious

comment: He's alright. He's really smart, but I think his accent makes it difficult to understand when he's introducing topics.  He's very helpful though when he goes over specific problems. He'll go through every step in the solution. His homework is way harder than his tests. If you do all the homework you will do really well on the tests.

He is the absolute worst teacher i have ever taken in my history as a student. He doesn't explain things well at all, he just jumps around talking about math and things him and his Chinese friends do. His slides are PDF and doesn't explain topic thoroughly.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: First math class I ever had to withdraw from. Hilarious person but his teaching style just didn't mesh with me. Also his grading was very tough on the fist test. Not a horrible professor just not my type.

(Numerical Methods I) Assigns 5-6 Matlab projects throughout the semester that were like 35% of the grade, and they're not that tough. He's a really strict grader, and isn't clear about how he's going to grade things. Pretty hard to understand in lectures; almost all theory. He's also hilarious, and has everything graded by the next day somehow.

He is reasonable.  If you ask him questions after class, he will go as far as you would like to go in depth.  He has the knowledge, but he won't help the lazy.  He will go the extra mile for students that show they want it.

Professor Ji is a speed demon when it comes to teaching always commenting to refer to the notes which he prints from D2L. Sometimes reading the book can help you understand better than his notes. Working practice problems will save your life in this class and he is always willing to help if you need it. Office hours are very helpful.

I understand Calculus II is difficult, but Professor Jun makes it even harder. He doesn't show you how to work problems. Instead, he goes over the examples that are in the book. He has a VERY thick accent. His office HOUR was very limited. I learned more from watching YouTube videos. Attendance is mandatory or he'll dock your grade

His lectures aren't always helpful (namely if you get behind), but if you're willing to study the book (which he follows closely), his notes, and the homework, you can get an A fairly easily. In fact, compared to the homework problems, his (3) tests are almost trivial.  He grades pretty reasonably, too (e.g., barely counting off for sign errors)

Imagine Jackie Jan teaching Math. This is Jun Ji. He is energetic and passionate about math. He has an accent but it is completely understandable unlike some teachers I have had. The subject is hard, but he does his best to make you understand. Unless you have a strong math background you must do the homework to pass the quizzes.

Hard to understand, a lot of homework, medium test difficulty but one wrong answer  1 letter grade off. My biggest problem was not being able to finish the whole chapter before the test and of course the majority of the questions come from the last section of the chapter. Taught me how to work with difficult people. He can be helpful with yr grade

Where he loves his topic, he goes too fast and is very discouraging when you don't understand or make small errors. I love math, but his accent caused me to zone out and I barely escaped with a B. Doing well in his class takes a lot of effort. But if you fail a test, he gives quizzes that will completely replace problems on tests. so there is hope.

He is very passionate and always tells students to come to his office for help. He spends 20 minutes at each class answering questions (past units or current). He teaches strictly from the book, teaches fast-paced (allows questions during), tests are as difficult as the homework, and tells you flat out, if you cant do algebra, he can't help you.

Homework is not mandatory, but it is advised. The tests are all very easy if you pay attention in class. Tests are easy, as in he gives you basic problems not trying to trick you. He LOVES math. I liked how attendance and homework are not mandatory. More than half the class did withdraw though.

His accent is hard to navigate. He literally goes thru every example and almost all proofs. The proof part is useless. He should do more examples and open up for questions of what he covers but doesn't til next mtg. DO NOT TAKE Calc III with him in Summer. He has U do hmwork/covers sections he doesn't test on. Gets impatient with others. Stay away!

He is very excited about math. His class was fast paced. He was more interested in trying to finish the book than making sure the students understood the material. He did take a few minutes most classes to go over some homework problems but he assigned to many problems for someone taking a full load. Know MORE than just what is on his test review!

I am pretty sure Ji's favorite thing in life is math itself.  However, he has very poor english and goes too fast.  He often goes off on tangents teaching you things that you don't need.  Also, he will mislead you come test days.  He will tell you what will be on the exam during review, but its about 50% accurate so learn everything.  Avoid him!

Dr. Ji is an incredible professor. He adores mathematics in a way that forces you to fall in love with it as well. He is quick-paced and not always as clear as I'm sure he would like to be, but there is a lot of material to cover in calculus 2 and he does his best organize is lectures accordingly. I have never met a more enthusiastic professor!

He is an awesome guy and loves to help you, but is not always easy to understand. Calc II is not easy and you must know the basics to succeed trig identities, unit circle, etc.). You're not given formula sheets for tests, but I found thus helpful because it forced me to better learn the material. If you understand hwk, you will do well on tests.

He is very passionate about math  .  But his class is hard.  He does have an accent but it becomes easier to understand after the second or third class.  He uses the textbook a lot and takes attendance.  I did not like how he gave one-question quizzes. Study the homework questions, the test is very similar.  Go to class/ask questions-you will be ok
I really enjoyed his classes, and I definitely recommend him to everyone.

Jun Ji is always in a good mood, it brightens your day. He is extremely helpful and nice. The problem though is is grading system. Your grade rides on 3 tests, 10% quizzes and attendance. There is no homework grade. This is nice for someone who knows the material but we need free points where we can get them. Only recommend if you are a good tester

I agree Jun Ji was always in a good mood. The math was hard but many still aced it. We went over many proofs that we didn't need, but might help those interested in math theory. There were 3 tests and 7 quizzes, and he did give partial credit on questions if he saw you were on the right track but derailed somewhere. Nice person, beast of a class.

Jun Ji seems to always be very happy. However this is where the good ends. He is very difficult to understand. He is very hard to follow in class. Seems to talk on and on, especially about proofs that we could have done without. Your grade rides on 3 tests and a 13 percent of quizes... very hard to do well. avoid if possible.

Jun Ji is a very nice man, but he is not the best at communicating the subject material. He's smart and knows his stuff. You need to go to class and do homework. The quizzes and tests are straight from the homework. He's a fair grader, but you have to do the work. He also grades you more easily if he knows you've been in class and ask questions.

Very good professor. Explains things very well and in ways you can understand. Very very VERY funny. Always had us cracking up in class. Several quizzes given, problems come from the book sometimes we actually would do a problem straight from the book. Only three tests, but again questions from the book. Do the homework and you'll do good.
Jun Ji is the best. He is a very comprehensible teacher. His mathematical knowledge is superb. In addition Jun Ji has the best sense of humor!

He is a sweet guy but just hard to understand him english at first. He is very willing to help you outside of class. There are no study guides before tests but just do all the homework assigned because he picks the medium difficulty level problems from the book. His tests are VERY reasonable and will even replace your lowest test grade by the final

Worst professor ever! He is difficult to understnad and does not explain material well enough. He does seem to have an understanding of the course but if you have no previous calculus knowledge DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASSES!

Jun Ji is a terrible upper level calculus teacher.  it is obvious that he has some knowledge but is terrible at communicating in a way that students can learn.  Quizzes are a joke and his tests are not fun either.  Would not recommend to anyone.

Dr. Ji is a horrible teacher. I love math, but he makes me hate it! He doesn't know how to pass his knowledge to others. He tells you that you are not smart and that you should change your mayor. Makes fun of you when you turn in your quizzes and the answer is incorrect. DO NOT TAKE HIM!!

Dr. Ji is a very nice and fun professor, but he isn't the best at breaking math down. Although the material is hard, his tests are fair, so sign up for him if you plan on spending several hours a week studying and getting outside help. I was able to do well in the class because of how hard I worked inside and outside of the class.

Dr Ji is a very helpful teacher. He goes over examples many times until everybody in the class understands. He always encourage his students to ask questions. Sometimes he gets very excited teaching and his his accent may be hard to understand at first. Make sure you do the HW. His tests are very fair almost identical to the HW assignments.

Ive had two courses with professor Ji, 1 math course, and another in a study abroad where I went to China. He is a very entertaining character and will HELP you. Every course is what you make of it. If you dont put anything in, don't expect anything.

I can sum it up quickly.  Jun Ji is a horrible teacher with very high expectations, which is the worst combination possible, in my opinion.  The fact that he is very nice, sort of funny, and clearly very bright in no way makes up for the fact that he is incapable of passing on his knowledge to others.

Jun Ji is a very smart teacher. he takes attendance every so often, you'll have a quiz maybe once every 2 weeks, so try to pay attention in class. 3 tests, including final and replaces you lowest test with your highest test grade. somewhat hard, i didn't do too well but still got a high B in there. hes a funny guy tho so it kinda helps

ji is a good teacher.... for higher math classes or people who had really awesome math teachers in hs if you don't get the hell out of there plain and simple. its not that hes a bad teacher its just his patience is short for stupid ques and small things that ppl like me mess up on when they are sketchy. he is very smart though

Dr. Ji is an extremely smart person. Unfortunately he is too smart to break down his steps into simpler formats. He is really funny in class and makes fun of everything!! Very cute personality but teaching technique is kind of difficult.

Jun Ji is truly passionate about his job and teaching life skills beyond the material. It REALLY helps if you do the homework, but most of it is review. He makes jokes and fun of himself so the class goes by quickly. Take his class if you can.
He is helpful but doesnot have good teaching skills.
He is a great teacher
He is really excited when it comes to math. He doesn't listen to the questions and jumps to conclusions, but give it a chance and you'll do fine.

A bit tough to understand at first (and upon occasion throughout the term), but very thorough. Drives home important concepts and "hints" at great test questions. The book is a must, as is 60% of the homework. Tough attendance policy unless you have friends in class to jot down your name. If I had to take it over, I'd take him again.

I absolutely dreaded calculus and waited until my last undergraduate semester to take it.  Dr. Ji is not only knowledgable but, patient with stupid questions and really pretty amusing.  If you do the homework as instructed, you should do well on tests.   Yes, he has an accent, but after a week or so, I understood everything the man said.

ok so just come to class everyday and do the homeowrk and you will be just fine... and the whole thing of not being able to understand him is false... he is not that hard to understand... and dont take his jokes personal. He is a lot of fun and for Cal class you will NOT find a better teacher! Cal is hard! but he is the best teacher for it!

You really need to be passionate about math when you're taking this course. Do the homework since his tests are straight from them.  He goes over a few problems in class which helps a little.  He wants you to really understand how to solve the problems.  If you have any questions, he's willing to help.

He knows his stuff very well but the Chinese accent is overwhelming...really hard 2 understand. Gotta have a passion 4 MATH b4 u take him, he won't ginger u up very much...more like "whatever u want" guy. Take another person if u can
Great teacher, funny guy--math is definitly not boring with this guy. Heavy accent as noted. Overall a good teacher made a B w/o doing any homework, and i failed the class before.
He is a very nice teacher. Do the homework and you will be sure to do good on the tests. Cute.
No Comments
good teacher. tests are simple and usually only a few questions. only thing you need to worry about in this class is keeping up with hw cuz his tests are straight from the book.
